channel.title: windows on The Miette
channel.description: Recent content in windows on The Miette

item.title: January Build Update
item.description: A January build update We get glass in window frames. Table Of Contents What we’ve done Highlights Challenges What’s next? What we’ve done In December last year Lys’ parents gently highlighted that they want their garage back. So, with a deadline of September 30th and some wonderful sunshine we decided to nail these windows down. Honestly, we try write these blogs once a month but sometimes its difficult to encapsulate every trial and tribulation when you cannot even begin to remember them all.

item.title: November December Build Update
item.description: An November December build update Window making continues with a side of weddings, berry farms, and other sundry end of year activities. Table Of Contents What we’ve done Highlights Challenges What’s next? What we’ve done So while writing this blog post, Lys discovers there’s a frisbee emoji ü•è also known as the flying disc emoji - how random! Tiny house wise though - our journey continues working on our windows.

item.title: Oct Build Update
item.description: An October build update We got solar! ‚òÄÔ∏è ‚òÄÔ∏è ‚òÄÔ∏è Table Of Contents What we’ve done Highlights Challenges What’s next? What we’ve done One of our neighbours decided to demolish their house without removing their 10 year old solar system (it was not cost effective for them to re-install). Luckily for us they said that if we could take it down we could have it! Erny clambered onto the roof on a balmy Sunday day to bring the panels down.

item.title: August September 2022 Build Update
item.description: An August September build update Hello Spring! Working almost every weekend, these last two months we’ve actually got a proper build update üòÑ. Table Of Contents What we’ve done Highlights Challenges What’s next? What we’ve done We went through our stash of 90x45mm lengths and picked out roof rafters. These have been measured down to a 20 degree angle and some have been cut to size! We’ve been doing this in the garage when there has been a rain shower break and it has worked quite well.

item.title: A Quick Trip to Canberra
item.description: A quick trip to Canberra In January we sped down to Canberra to pick up some double glazed glass for our windows. We had been on the hunt for double glazed glass closer to home but it seems that Canberra - having cold winters - has great reclaimed glass options. Table Of Contents Introducing Handyman Trading Post A side step antiquing So what’d you get? But why use double glazing?
